texts.text: The hologram smiles at me gently.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi and I...

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: Yeah, we married. Though it took quite a while.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A memory disorder, huh?
A man who can't forget anything, and a woman who would some day lose her memory.
Kind of ironic we ended up married.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: Those were the happiest days of my life.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: We decided to make the most of every day, and that's what we did. Day by day, sharing our happiness together.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: Even now, those days shine bright in my memory.
I nod in response.
I believe I understand.
My memories are coming back.
Memories of newlywed life with Yonagi come back to me, as vivid and clear as the day they happened.
We had already been living together for years, so nothing really changed.
But we swore not to waste a single day together.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: That's when I... When I became aware of my duty.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: To make migration to the virtual space a reality.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: I believed it would save Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito (Hologram)
texts.text: I believed that, back then...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've remained dedicated to research and development of the virtual space since my days at Asuma Lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It will serve as a temporary measure to conserve resources until life on the surface can be achieved; a respite until a fundamental solution to the problem is invented.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You may not be aware of this, since you are all middle side citizens, so I won't mince words.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Life is brutal for the people on the low side. I still live in the area, so I know.
Faint murmurs spread throughout the classroom.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The day will come when humans stand once more under the sun and feel the wind upon our faces. When we're there standing on firm ground and looking up at the sky...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This simulated space will no longer be necessary.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I also believe that this will help prepare the general public for the migration and eventual resettling on the surface.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Some favor achieving this through environmental changes, like expanding the ozone lens. Others favor a physiological approach, changing our own biology.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I believe that either of these solutions would take at least three decades of research to come to fruition.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: On the other hand, creating the virtual space would take just three years.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: With the Kaito Lab handling the program's architectural algorithms, and Asuma Lab developing the stasis facilities for our physical bodies...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...over ninety percent of the population would be able to migrate to the virtual space in just three years. The solution is available to anyone who can dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In other words, anyone with consciousness.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There are very few health conditions that could pose a problem to entry. All sensory information associated with normal, everyday life is directly sent to the user's brain.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Everyone here is free to take a trial run of the virtual space today. We will induce REM sleep and enable you to move about freely in an environment prepared for the occasion.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Go to the Kaito Lab on the second floor if you want to try it.
I can feel the audience's excitement growing as I speak.
They're reaching the limits of their attention span.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Finally, I'd like to remark that the separation of the Kaito Lab from the Asuma Lab was done in service of the plan's overall efficiency.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I assure you that there is no animosity between teacher and pupil, despite what rumors might suggest.
I hear a few chuckles from the audience.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Both labs are fully committed to research and development of the virtual space until such time as the migration plan is realized.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's the extent of the trust both laboratories are putting on this plan.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's all for now. A question and answer session will be held after the demonstration.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you all for your time and presence here today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey there, Professor!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You rocked it back there!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You were looking pretty cool, tiger!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I didn't expect anything less than stellar, of course!
I manage a smile back at them.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Truly an awe-inspiring display. However, three years is a rather optimistic deadline, if you ask me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The people will prefer a bold three-year plan that gets postponed to five to a timid ten-year plan that gets done in eight.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But a bold three-year plan that gets done in three would be preferable, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Indeed.
I let out a small laugh.
And so, the first research presentation since the founding of Kaito Lab comes to a satisfactory conclusion.
I hear I'm the youngest lab director in the institute's history.
It's true that I've worked hard every day since joining Asuma Lab. I can take rightful pride in the work that I've done.
But luck was still the biggest factor in my success.
The once promising Asuma Lab had been stagnating at the time that I joined them.
It meant that my achievements stood out more than they would have otherwise.
Yonagi was also a huge factor in my success.
After we married, we decided to tell professor Asuma about her power.
She said she wanted to be a part of my research.
Her words had given me the courage to pursue what I believed in.
They lit a fire under my discussions with the professor.
She gave us a true vision of the virtual space we were shooting for.
Once the three of us started tackling the development of the dreamscape emulator together, things picked up steam.

And before I knew it, the lab was too small for all of us. We made the decision to separate and let Asuma Lab focus on developing the hardware, while the newly established Kaito Lab would be in charge of building up the software.
That's when I called on Iruma. He came just as he promised, becoming my right-hand man and chief of research.

We found that the efficiency of the data collection process increased when Yonagi was building the virtual spaces, and we also learned that the state of the dreamscape changed depending on her mental state.
I'd come to think that her dreamscapes were built on something like a feeling of empathy towards those she brings into it.
So the concept of my research became “an empathic virtual world.”
I used that concept as my true north, and it came to the rescue several times when I hit a snag.
The purpose of the current build is to reproduce the ambiguity of the human brain.
Up to three people can share the same space now.
Suffice to say, we still have a long road ahead of us.
But we're moving forward, and every day feels fulfilling.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I must say, that was the most inspiring research presentation in recent memory. I see we've been needing the passion that only the youngest ever lab director can muster.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're gonna make me blush if you keep calling me that, Institute Director.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Ah, I see what you mean, heh. All right.
My emphasis on his newly regained title gets a chuckle out of him.
After a few years relegated to the institute's bottom rung, he's now back to his position as its director.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Are you taking off from standard business today?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, everyone was up all night preparing for this.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: We'll probably be back tomorrow though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
Professor Asuma nods at us.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So the trials to support larger groups come next, yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. The emulator still struggles with three, so our next task is gathering lots observational data from larger numbers of people.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Are you feeling up to it, Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep, I'm fit as a fiddle. I'm actually more worried about Kaito. He barely gets a wink of sleep these days!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I sleep. It's just that I do it while no one's looking.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sounds pretty suspect to me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How about taking the day to relax? No man should make their wife worry like that.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah! We're definitely not making that three year deadline if you work yourself to death!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You heard them!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm, I suppose you're right.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Let us discuss our future plans tomorrow. Could you drop by my office in the morning?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But please take today to celebrate your accomplishment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah! Wait! Can I ask you two to do something for me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um, would you mind if we take a picture together?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: A picture?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh! Sounds like fun! Let's do it!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's a big day for my husband, so I want something to remember it by!
Her words bring an awkward smile to my face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Or are you in a hurry, Professor?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Perish the thought. It would be my honor.
Yonagi produces a familiar polaroid camera from her bag.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You want to do it today?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, seems like our only chance.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Ah, that brings back memories!
The professor's gaze is fixated on the camera she's holding.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's the same one Shiona used, yes?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes. I'm taking pictures with it, the same way I think my father would have.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's good.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It's a special occasion, so let's put you two in the middle of the shot! Hey, can someone lend me a hand?
One of our colleagues at Kaito Lab comes over and takes the camera from Yonagi.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Come on now, Mister Awkward! Move in closer to your wife!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You too, Professor! C'mon!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is great! Press the shutter button, please!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Goodie!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.
The researcher promptly hands the picture spat out by the camera and the camera itself back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I trust you know how much of a rarity that polaroid camera is.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't I know it! I can't get my hands on film, so I only use it in special occasions.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Really? Are you sure you wanted me in the picture, then?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Of course! You and Professor Asuma are all Kaito talks about at home.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh? Now that's made my day! No, maybe my lunch!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Only lunch?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Your lab has a good energy, Kaito. I see promise here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's all thanks to you, Professor.
The two of us look over the bustling lab.
This was originally his lab.
We shared a lot of time here, just the two of us, discussing and running experiments.
And now it's positively crowded.
I wonder if he's as moved as I am by the sight.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Well then, I'll be taking my leave. Take care, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes, thank you!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can I leave you in charge for a bit?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah, there's not much to do today. We'll make sure things are back in shape for business as usual tomorrow.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Go and take the day off. You need the rest, for real.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You tell him! He really worries me sometimes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, I got the message. See you all tomorrow.
The researchers turn to me and nod or wave me off.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! See you all tomorrow!
After parting with the professor in front of the institute, he heads for the researcher residential area, while we board the elevator to the low side.
Even now, we walk the same dirt roads.
The same path between the corn fields to get back home.
We get off the central elevator and walk side by side, hands locked together.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Director Kaito, of Kaito Lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't start, please.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! You're just amazing! You're climbing up the ranks so fast.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's only thanks to you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ever since you started actively helping with the research, the progress has been staggering.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I mean, you did accept me. Despite everything.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.
Yonagi takes one of my hands in both of hers and holds it tight.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Seeing you working so hard, I started feeling like I wanted to make a difference too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whatever I did, I wanted to do it with you. And your research is sort of like a continuation of my father's anyway...
Yonagi then pulls out the picture from earlier and flaps it a few times in the air before taking a look.
It depicts the four of us with broad smiles on our faces.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It just felt like a natural development for me, I guess.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks for that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But the biggest reason is still that it lets me be with you for a few more hours during the day.
No matter how many years we've been married, she's still able to make me blush.
My feelings for her have remained as strong as ever.
The more memories we make together, the more I grow to love everything about her.
But I still have trouble saying it out loud.
I'm always so impressed by how easily she expresses her feelings.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I still kind of miss working up a good sweat with physical work, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But you're still working to help the city.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And you're doing something only you can do. I think it's very noble.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I guess you're right.
We walk for a while, hearing the crunch of the soil beneath our shoes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You sure about that picture, though?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was the last, wasn't it?
She looks up at me, visibly confused.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How did you know?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The encyclopedia entry for polaroid cameras says that most of the film for them came in sets of eight.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And there's seven pictures in your room, so...
Yonagi gives me an exasperated smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Man, that memory of yours really is unparalleled.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's not all roses though.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I can't keep much from you, can I? You take one look at something and never forget!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You'd totally realize if I started cheating or something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I would totally see through that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! Not that I ever would!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I know.
She stares at the picture for a while.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I thought today would be a good time for it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I figured if we were going to take one with those two who mean so much to us, it had to be today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's a really happy day for me too, you know?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So the camera's done its part, and now it can rest. That's fine.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! I think it was great to use the last picture on such a happy moment.
She beams up at me as she speaks.
I return the smile in kind.
And so, we head back home to where Izumo is waiting.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're back!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hello there.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome home.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito's presentation went super well! Right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I managed not to screw it up.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: That's good news.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But all that work's left me famished!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Shall I prepare dinner early?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, first we run the tests. Yonagi, sit down.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? But it's your big day! Can't we skip it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's irrelevant. Izumo, if you will.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Display activated. Please tell how many boxes you see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mmh... Uh... Nine.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I shall display the next image. Please tell me how many boxes you see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ngh... Mm... Nine again.
After learning about her possible condition, I took a deep, hard look at papers relating to cognitive impairment.
But despite reading all the literature from around the year 2100, when technology on the surface was at its most advanced, I came across no definitive cure for her condition.
Early signs of the illness frequently presented themselves in small, everyday things.
An inability to tell time.
An inability to read calendars.
Forgetting the layout of one's own home.
These symptoms often appeared prior to any detectable changes in a person's biology.
And there was no precedent for using artificial cells to treat neurological diseases.
Neuroscientists managed to determine that one of the causes of cognitive impairment is the accumulation of waste matter called beta-amyloid.
Most people suffering from dementia are older, but it's possible to develop it at a younger age.
In such people, the cause is likely to be genetic mutations.
The tests Yonagi had done before we married were to determine whether she carried this mutation.
Those tests came back positive.
Yonagi had the gene.
But knowing that didn't help us. There was no treatment for it.
Methods had been tested, but none of them perfected.
Not even artificial gene therapy.
The study of human anatomy stagnated before scientists even got close to figuring out why beta-amyloid accumulates in the brain.
To track her progression, I ended up creating a program to measure basic memory, language, and arithmetic skills, which I installed in Izumo.
I've been studying her results every day since.
We've prepared ourselves for her results to start worsening one day.
We live day by day, always prepared for bad news.
I watch her bio data readings as she takes the test.
She's a picture of health.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It's finished.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will transmit the results now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you. Now we can have dinner.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, finally!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How many do you think attended today? It was standing room only after a point.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's because I opened the presentation up to junior researchers. I wanted as many people as possible to see it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe some of those kids will be inspired to join your lab!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think a lot of them must be looking at you the way you used to look at Professor Asuma.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That would be nice.
Our everyday life together hasn't changed.
We sit together at our small table, enjoying Izumo's porridge.
These are the moments of our day that we treasure the most.
But some things have changed, of course.
We no longer need Izumo and Wooleep to collect data from her dreamscape.
Our labs in the institute have developed have their own interfaces that are backwards compatible with the data previously gathered by Wooleep.
We also developed a touch-based relay with increased transmission capacity.
Izumo and Wooleep are back to just being our family.
I was also able to give Izumo a full initialization.
An android's OS security can't be breached in standard ways, but the place where the OS was developed is housed in the institute.
It's a facility staffed only by topsiders, but Professor Asuma was able to request the initialization be done after his reinstatement as director of the institute.
We had the option to restore her lost functionalities, but we declined.
We didn't want to imply that she was broken as she was, and porridge was the only dish we really wanted her to make.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks, Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes.
She quickly clears the plates away and takes them to the sink for washing.
After dinner, Yonagi stares at me across the dining table.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How about... we go up tonight?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Oh, okay.
And one other thing has changed.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo, we're gonna go take a walk, okay?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. I should wait for your return tomorrow night, yes?
Yonagi and I share glances.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
We started going on our nighttime "walks" together after getting married.
We go to one place in particular, actually.
The house in the middle side.
I got it when I became a researcher. Now it's good for when I want to really focus on something, and for when I want to spend some alone time with my wife.
I no longer resent midsiders like I did when I was younger.
We still spend most of our time on the low side, but we use the middle side house when we need it.
I actually enjoy the feeling of distancing ourselves from the city's social stratification.
As soon as we walk through the door, Yonagi wraps her arms around my neck and gives me a deep, fiery kiss.
I run my hands down her curves and hold onto her hips.
Her tongue finds its way into my mouth and twines with mine.
For a while we stay locked like that, relishing in each other's embrace.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How about we take a shower?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good idea.
Quirking an impish smile, Yonagi slowly heads for the bathroom, undressing as she goes.
I follow right after.
She slips off the last of her clothing, as natural as can be.
I follow her lead and step in after her.
After making love, I gently stroke Yonagi's hair as she rests against my body.
Her warm sighs brush against my chest.
The more we come together, the more confident and assertive she grows.
Her moans have grown loud and feverish, and she's gotten interested in trying more and more positions.
I guess it's that innate, boundless curiosity of hers.
I've memorized her every expression, sound, and sensation.
I enjoy playing all those moments back in my mind.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kernel of corn for your thoughts?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thinking about today's presentation?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, actually...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I was thinking about you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: About how you've been getting wilder in bed as of late.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! You're thinking about that now? We just did it, remember?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Exactly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well? Are we feeling frisky again?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think I can rein myself in.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aw, you're such a tease!
Yonagi looks up at me, a satisfied smile on her face.
She then nuzzles her soft cheek against my chest.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So when you and the professor finish your virtual space and all...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You think it will make everyone in this town happy?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It will, I'm sure.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm, right. That's why you're working so hard.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's keep fighting the good fight.
We stay like that for a good while, staring out the LCD panel that's visible out of the window.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Stay with me after I fall asleep, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You usually just get up to go to work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You thought I wasn't gonna realize sooner or later? You push yourself too hard!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Have a good night's sleep and we can give it our all tomorrow. What do you say?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You win.
Satisfied with my answer, Yonagi rests her head on my chest and closes her eyes.
My gaze goes back out the window as I stroke her hair.
Hearing her calm breathing, a thought surfaces in my head.
Does dementia advance while she sleeps?
The effects of sleep on the brain are largely unknown.
If we managed to finish the virtual space before her condition appears, she may be able to lead a full, healthy life in there.
As far as I know, no one has ever developed dementia while in a coma.
The question is, will I finish the virtual space before she loses her sense of self?
I don't have any time to waste.
After I make sure Yonagi's sleeping soundly, I quietly roll out of bed and turn on the terminal at my desk.
I keep working well until dawn. Then I take a little nap, wake up with Yonagi, and we walk to the lab together.
Ever since she started participating in my research, we've been able to walk to and from work together every day.
The group of researchers Iruma recruited are all reliable people.
His work at Kanou Lab, a huge place where researchers from all over the institute tend to gather, brought him a wealth of connections.
The power structure of the institute is shifting too.
Professor Asuma is back on as director, and the labs receiving the most attention are definitely ours.
It definitely feels satisfying to see the tables turn.
But I've no time to start getting complacent. There's work to do.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Go to the lab without me, Yonagi. The professor asked me to drop by first thing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I remember. You're going to his office, then?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll go get work started with the others.
Another sign of the shifting power balance is that more people greet me in the halls now.
I couldn't tell you who most of them are or what lab they belong to.
Still, I return every greeting as I head to the institute director’s office on the top floor.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's me, Kaito.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Ah, come in.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Good morning.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good morning, Director.
He gives me an awkward smile.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I thought we reached an agreement to stop calling each other by our titles yesterday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The grandeur of the office compelled me, I suppose.
The professor stands up and motions for me to sit on the sofa.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I understand. I don't spend much time here myself. There's not much in the way of materials or equipment here, and I'm still a researcher first and foremost.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This is just a little extra busywork.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The director is the face of the institute. There is no one more suitable for the job than you.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There's that youngest-ever lab director, with the spotless track record and fine word of mouth. I certainly pushed for him over me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't start with that. It's too much for me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: As it's too much for me. Though I'll fill the role to the best of my ability for as long as I'm stuck with it.
Asuma Lab is developing the hardware for the migration to the virtual space.
Unlike my lab, where the research mainly involves a lot of high-performance computers crunching numbers, his lab has to handle large-scale manufacturing.
We'll need to mass produce two million life support systems in the end.
Even developing the prototype will require some serious facilities.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Consolidation of redundant labs and archiving of obsolete research has left this floor almost empty.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Things are moving so fast it's almost hard to believe.
I remember when I was first assigned to his lab.
This floor was devoted to research on new drugs to combat the effects of UV rays.
But among all the avenues explored during that time, only a few were worth continued research.
But at least there were a few.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: They played their part. They gave the people something to hope for, if only for a time.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's not inherently dissimilar to what we're striving for now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's true.
He's right. The promise of increasing UV resistance through medicine did give the underground people hope.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The plan is to use this floor to develop the life support unit prototypes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So we're finally kicking things off.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We're leaning towards capsule-type enclosures. It is the most efficient design choice for nutritional supplementation and disposal of waste.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, better focus on functionality.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How are things on your end?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're improving the accuracy of the emulator and the parallel processing when there's multiple connections running at the same time.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So the same, then. I'd like to double the current pace, at least. Do you have enough people?
I chuckle and shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Not even close. I'm hoping some people will ask to transfer to my lab after yesterday's presentation.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Staffing problems tend to be frustrating, yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's something I'd like your input on.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want to get a support android for the lab.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: No objections from me. Let's get it arranged.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, I'd like to have our personal one help.
A knowing smile crosses his face.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The android you're living with, yes?
I give him a brief nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I didn't acquire her through legal means, see, so I was hoping adding her to my lab would be an opportunity to get her registered...
Professor Asuma grins at me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I see. You've gone from a little boy who didn't know what a motor was to a man who can even fix an android.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's a testament to the power of a good educational system.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Anyway, since I can't tell people how I got her, we can't take her out except at night.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But Yonagi and I both have a personal attachment to her.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Not a problem. Send me her serial number later. I'll register her as a support individual for your lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The end justifies the means, as they say. Our top priority is to build a virtual space fit for mass migration. An enterprise such as ours needs open minds and resolute hearts to do what must be done.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do what must be done, mm...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We've no time to dawdle. Three years go by in but a blink. We must start the migration tests before that.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You should consider delegating what you can to other labs too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't they have their own fields to worry about?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I can shift things around however you need. That's the reason I accepted this post.
I smile at him uneasily.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Did you not explain it yesterday? A fundamental solution will take at least thirty years, whereas ours will only take three.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: A one-year delay would represent a three-percent increase for them, but a thirty-three-percent increase for us.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Once our own research is complete, that mere three percent can easily be made up via careful allocation of resources to the most feasible surface migration solution.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Makes sense.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: On the flip side... It means a lot of sleepless nights for us in the future.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All for a good cause.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I agree. I still remember the first day you came to my lab.
He smiles fondly and reminiscences about a few years back.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I believe this will be my last chance to make this dream a reality. Let's make it happen, my friend.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll put my heart and soul into it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Glad to hear it. Okay then.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How about we start breaking your research down into fields? I'd like to decide which part of it we'll entrust to which labs.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right.
By the time we decide who to delegate the analysis work to, it's already evening.

The process involves taking the data from the dreamscape, matching recorded neurological reactions with corresponding events in the virtual space, and lining that up with previously gathered data to see what connections can be drawn between the two.
We'll divide that process into as many small steps as possible and ask labs working in related fields to take on the load.
If this goes according to his plan, Kaito Lab will be able to concentrate solely on recording Yonagi's data.
That means we can focus on the part of the research only we can do, such as increasing the diversity of the dreamscape, and exploring ways to increase the number of concurrent participants.
I know there will be institute politics to contend with, but the professor will take care of everything on that front.
I don't think I could do what he does.
The amount of influence and power he acquired after coming back from obscurity and into the director's chair is staggering.
I feel proud that it was my research that helped him get back there.
My business with him done, I run back to the lab.
I had planned to be back by the afternoon, but the talks went on for too long.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There you are! Kept me waiting, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry, the talks with the professor dragged on a little.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I figured so.
I open the door to what's now known as the Kaito Lab.
It's where the Asuma Lab used to be.
It's still hard for me to shake that old association.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: We're ready here, Kaito. We've gotten ahead on all the emulator work.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good, let's get started. Yonagi, if you will.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sure thing!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Bring up the latest error ratios for the emulator.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Coming up.
I look at the numbers on the screen.
It's the error ratio for each of the participants in the emulator and the origins of each error.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're still on the double digits with three people. Mm... Definitely not good enough for practical use.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: The attenuation rates have been decreasing lately, so perhaps we should add more batch processors.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's have the emulator keep reinforcing the three-subject data. Use the model city three, event list 3200 to 3500.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: On it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Meanwhile, we'll have the dreamscape test communication between four subjects. Run event list 0001 to 0030.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Gotcha.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's see it on the monitor.
The LCD screen shows an image of a beautiful cityscape.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: The sight is so breathtaking. I don't think I'll ever get tired of it.
We're currently engaged in two major lines of work: improving the existing emulator's accuracy and gathering brainwave data from the people participating in Yonagi's dreamscape.
Perhaps the job of improving the emulator will be left to another lab in the future.
But the process of accumulating the master data from Yonagi's dreamscape that we'll feed into the emulator can only be done here.
The only ones that know about the truth are me, the professor, and certain trustworthy members of Kaito Lab including Iruma.
We've built a relationship of trust with them over the years.
My initial belief that if we could collect data from three or more participants we'd be able to extrapolate that to any number of people sadly missed the mark.

There has to be a threshold of how many people have to be together before the mind recognizes them as an amorphous “group,” and we'll just have to keep gathering master data until we reach that number.
A thesis published back when humanity lived on the surface put that number as seven.
The human brain recognizes each person as an individual entity up to seven people. Anything beyond that, the brain begins to process as a group.
So the threshold for the brain to process people efficiently lies between seven and eight.
I believe that if we could increase the number of people from whom we're obtaining reciprocal communication data to seven, the error ratio would drop dramatically.
The only issue...
Is whether Yonagi's mind can handle having that many people in her dreamscape at the same time.
Beads of sweat have started surfacing on her forehead.
I turn my eyes to the monitor displaying her vitals.
Her heart rate has increased sharply.
As has her body temperature.
Iruma turns my way.
I nod at him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's enough for now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you okay?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah... All fine.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's rest a bit.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But we're not done getting data for the day, are we?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're increasing the number of people in the dreamscape, so your body may not be used to the load. It's fine to take our time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm...
I turn back to my colleagues.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry, I want to let her rest early today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Keep working on increasing the emulator's accuracy.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You got it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The professor and I discussed it, and we'll probably be leaving that work to another lab from now on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want you to break down what the work entails and make a manual for them to use.
I instruct Iruma to take over for me, then Yonagi and I leave the lab.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sorry, I know we don't have much time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No. the whole plan is possible only because of you, and it'd fall to pieces without you. There's no need to push yourself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I talked with the professor, and we'll get help from the other labs. I also asked him to let us bring Izumo over.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah! You finally asked him? What did he say?!
I nod in response and answer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll be able to come together starting tomorrow.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! It'll be so much more fun with her around! I just know she must be feeling sad stuck house sitting every day!
My colleagues in the lab know about Yonagi’s power and Izumo.
They know most about our lives, really.
The only thing we haven’t mentioned is the possibility of her memory condition.
Yonagi asked that no one but me and Professor Asuma should know.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Running the experiments with Izumo reminds me of back when you built the first emulator back home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah... Back then it was only the three of us dreaming together.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And now the whole city is counting on your research.
I nod again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It’s rewarding and intimidating in equal measure.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's okay. I know you can do it.
She gently takes my hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We’re back!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, run the test, please.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes. This way, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Coming!
As usual, her results don't deviate much from the average.
The difficulty of the test is set so that not even a completely healthy person can get a perfect score.
In fact, she tends to be happy about setting records when she feels well, but they tend to drop when she's tired from work.
It also depends on how focused she is on the test.
As long as there’s not a huge deviation from the average, there’s no problem.
Her father...
Shiona married a fellow researcher he met at Asuma Lab, and Yonagi was born from that union.
That means he must have been experimenting on himself before passing down his genes to Yonagi.
We don't know if the case of Alzheimer's he developed was a side effect of experiments, or if he also inherited it from his parents.
We have no way of finding out now.
Yonagi and I have spoken about it at length.
She decided that, regardless, she wanted to do what she could
to see the virtual space project realized.
I respected her decision, of course.
My duty to her is to bring the project to fruition as soon as possible while and keeping an eye on her health and supporting her however she needs.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, I'd like you to work with us starting tomorrow.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: With you? At the institute?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. From today onward, you'll be officially registered as an android issued to Kaito Lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You have nothing to hide from our colleagues, but when you're around anyone else, try to avoid talking about anything but our research.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can’t wait for the three of us to walk together tomorrow! Let’s work hard, Izumo!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: What about Wooleep?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Will he be relegated to house sitting alone?
All of Wooleep's auxiliary functions are also available in the lab.
In the strictest sense, there would be no need to bring him along...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: My processing efficiency increases twenty-two percent with Wooleep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You’d feel better having him around?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm...
Yonagi stares into Izumo’s eyes for a moment, then turns to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think she wants to take Wooleep too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Figures.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right. Sounds like we're taking Wooleep too.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I’m glad to hear that.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Good morning.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Hey there, Cap! Good morning to you too, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Morning!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can I have everyone's attention? I want to introduce you to the newest official member of our lab. Her name is Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I’m thrilled to be here.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh, so that's her?
I answer with a nod.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Whoa, she’s incredible. She doesn’t look broken at all.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I am not broken.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Ah, I’m so sorry! I didn’t mean anything bad by it. Nada personal!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And the little guy floating behind her is Wooleep. I made him to be her auxiliary terminal. Yonagi designed him, actually.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Huh?! You made this?! You can do hardware too?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Only if it’s simple stuff, I guess.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I kneel in front of your mastery.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Though he couldn’t draw to save his life.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think it's more a matter of taste than of skill.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How blessed you are to have such a gracious wife that would let you harbor such delusions.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He was originally made to assist in the transmission of Yonagi's dreamscape and boost Izumo's calculation power.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: At the time her dreamscape was more like, well, a dream for us, so...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Ah, I get it now. So it's a woolly sheep that aids sleep, therefore Wooleep.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: He, not it.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: He is not an it, he is a boy.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Ah, you gave it a pronoun, eh?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: As per its creator’s wishes.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I see. I’ll keep that in mind.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll connect Izumo to the lab terminals, so you can use her as a voice input interface as well.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Again, thrilled to be here.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: A pleasure to meet you, Izumin.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Izumin.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What is that?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Just a nickname. Sounds crazy cute!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Crazy? Do I appear insane?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: No, no, no! Don’t focus on the loco part! I just said you’re really cute! Adorable!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Is that so?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: May I keep calling you Izumin?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: If it pleases you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! Aren’t we off to a good start, Izumin?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Introduce yourselves when you have time. It can be through words, or you can send your data if you like.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Copy that!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Also, we figured out how to divvy up the data collection to other labs and wrote up the manuals, but what now? Do we know where they're going already?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, the director already informed me of their specialties. I believe it's mostly decided.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But we should probably send someone over, at least on the first day, to walk them through it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right...
I have a look over the researchers in the lab.
The resources of the vacated labs are currently going unused.
I'd like to get them running alongside us as soon as possible.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want everyone here to focus on getting the support labs up to speed, except those needed for testing simultaneous connection to the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Since Izumo can handle the role of operator herself...
I designate Iruma and another female researcher for connection duties.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Aim to make the external labs able to work independently by the end of the day, or by tomorrow at the latest.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: From now on, our lab will be at the center of this whole project. We'll probably be forced to spend more time answering questions, but let's grin and bear it in the interests of efficiency.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: All clear.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, the process is the same as you're used to. Except you'll use this device instead of Wooleep as the relay, and you'll be connecting four people including Yonagi simultaneously.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The sessions will last forty-five minutes per set. If you notice a change in her temperature or her heart rate, stop the experiment immediately.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Having Izumo here makes me feel at ease.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let’s continue with the event list from where we left off yesterday.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yonagi’s heart rate has risen far above the average.
The connection drops in the middle of the basic communication event list.
I look at Yonagi.
She's already sweating again.
And I notice a slightly reddish shade in her cheeks.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sorry about that. But did I last a little longer than yesterday?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, time elapsed?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Twenty-eight minutes and forty-three seconds.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Goodie!

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It was less than twenty yesterday, so she’s making progress.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How are you feeling?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm, having more people really does exhaust me, but it’s not that bad.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It kind of feels nice, like when you've had a good workout.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let me rest and then we can give it another try. I think I can manage today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Okay. Let’s continue after a recess.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, I need to stop by the professor's office before going home. Go on and have dinner without me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, okay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You have some time, Iruma? I’d like you to come too.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Ah, we’re talking with Mr. Asuma? Sure, I’ll tag along.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: See you back home, Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You wanna talk about Yonagi, right?
I give him a swift nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The way things are going at present...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll never complete the virtual space.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Mm, I see.
We give the professor a brief rundown of the situation at the lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The exhaustion Yonagi displays after increasing the simultaneous connection to four people is simply too much.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But theoretically, in order to properly emulate the dreamscape, we need to get data on a simultaneous seven-person connection.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we can get the master data for a seven-person connection, we should be able to process any number of people after that as a group.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: When there's eight or more people, the brain perceives them as a group and processes them in a more mutable way, yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That’s right.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: We verified this with experiments in reality, so it's very possible that our simultaneous connection threshold is seven people too.
I nod as well.
I put Iruma in charge of running and reporting those experiments.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Three people isn’t so exhausting for her, but when we get to four, well... I don’t want to imagine what would happen if we tried five, let alone seven.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The burden on her could be increasing exponentially.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So the reason you’re seeking my council would be...
The professor slowly looks between us from his director chair.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You want my guidance as to how to find a solution, yes?
The way he looks at me gives me pause. There is a pressure in his gaze I don’t think I’ve ever felt before.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Incidentally, is this fatigue you mentioned something Yonagi is aware of?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Her temperature and heart rate increase, but she says she likes how it feels.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Like the high after a good workout.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I see. So the fatigue during the formation and maintenance of the dreamscape is essentially psychogenic in nature.
I nod in response.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Kaito, is your android recording her biometric data?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes. She’s always monitoring both of us.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Okay. Send over that data.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If we compare the differences between the effortless three-person tests and the strenuous four-person tests, we could pinpoint the cause behind the unconscious burden she feels.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So this is with three people, and this with four... Any patterns in the stimulated parts of her brain?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As usual, not really.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It varies depending on the action list being performed, and the person.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Mm, makes sense.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Also, how do you induce the REM sleep?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We’re using the same method you used. Sixty milligrams through oral ingestion. The ingredients of the formula are the same.
He nods along as I speak, his eyes studying the brain waves displayed on his terminal.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Comparing the brain waves from the two states, I can see that they're both a mix of θ and β waves.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Mm? Eh? Which means?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: θ waves are the brain wave frequency produced by the brain during light sleep. β waves occur when the mind is alert and engaged.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The ratio of θ waves when there's four people is considerably lower than when there's three, and she produces far fewer δ waves as well.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In short, her sleep is too shallow. Her brain isn't relaxed enough to withstand the load of four simultaneous connections.
Iruma looks at me, his head tilted in confusion.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: δ waves are the ones observed in the brain when the subject falls into a deep sleep.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I see... So that means she’s too tense to sleep well when there’s four people? Is it like insomnia?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's theorized that the body creates dreams as a way to protect its restful state.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They act as a cushion to keep the body from reacting even when the auditory or olfactory senses are stimulated.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Since her dreamscape is very similar to a real dream...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: ...Bringing outsiders into it makes the sleep shallower. Got it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Perhaps her mood also influences it to a certain extent.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Given the differences between the three- and four-person trials, it's clear that the probable cause is the β waves. Simply put, too much tension. However, we don't know what's happening in her brain either.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Tension, huh?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There is one drastic solution that comes to mind.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Connect to her when the δ waves are the main component to prevent the β waves from interfering with the process.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Looking at this, it's easy to imagine that the ratio of β waves will increase rapidly when you increase to the five- or six-person stage.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You may want to see if the effect is reduced if you perform the simultaneous connection while she's in a δ wave state.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But wouldn't that mean...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Creating a dreamscape in a non-REM sleep state, yes. If this approach works, it may completely solve the simultaneous connections issue.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm...
Non-REM is a period of deep sleep during which, it's believed, people generally don't dream.
In that state, Yonagi might not even have her own sense of self.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I understand what you mean. If she has no sense of self, it would let her skip the tension from consciously managing that many people.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It could. It’s just a possibility, at most.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But is that okay? I feel like it could just take an even bigger toll on her.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: People go into non-REM sleep every night. It's not as if we'd be knocking her out against her will.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The development of oral medications was a hot topic for a long time, so there's plenty of drugs that can produce non-REM sleep without straining the body.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: However.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The question is how you plan to explain this to her, Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I believe that seeing what's happening in her dreamscape helps her feel more at ease.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But we also have reason to believe that it's what's making her so tense.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's why you need to be the one to explain it to her.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: She's not going to let just anyone have full control of her body while she's unconscious.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I believe the only person she would trust with any degree of peace of mind in that situation would be you.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I leave the judgment on how to proceed to you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I'll see what she thinks first.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Mhm. If she doesn't feel comfortable, come back and we'll discuss alternatives.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.
The usual placid smile returns to his face.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How's the collaboration with the other labs coming along? Nicely, I hope?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, yes. Iruma led the process of selecting the data we could outsource, and today we've got members of our lab paying visits to orient them on the process.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It sounds like efficiency is about to go up.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We started the production of prototypes for the life support systems. There's some kinks to work out when it comes to durability and costs, but we're definitely on our way to providing a healthy and sterile environment.
He brings up an image of a capsule that looks like a white cocoon.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: They're designed to generate electricity through human metabolites while filtering and and purifying waste water for recirculation. It might be better if we don't explain how it works to the participants in detail.
I smile awkwardly.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's not a perpetual motion system, but we'll recycle the participants' bio-energy as much as possible. We should be able to improve on its efficiency from here on out as well.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The necessity of adopting a grain-based diet since the move underground has led to remarkable developments in the field of biotechnology.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We shall make use of that to accomplish the purpose of this institute.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We are taking the advancements our forebears pioneered to make our lives down here possible and using them to propel us to our next great advancement, the migration into virtual space.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What scientist can't see the poetry in that?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah.
He's right. Even my research is built on the foundation laid by Professor Aruma and Yonagi's father.
We can't just give up.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You hardware guys get the obvious poetry, at least.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: All we do is gather data all day long.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But it's your lab's work that forms the core of the entire project.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: All I'm doing is solving the problems that rise up around it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I believe that’s as invaluable. Not anyone could do the work you do.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yeah, and we can always come to you for advice.
Iruma and I nod at each other.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You’ll always be the best professor I ever had.
He smiles quietly at that.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You honor me. The true trials come now. Let’s see this through together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes!
The rest or our time together is spent with the professor explaining his ideas for how to improve the prototype manufacturing process, and elucidating on the labs we'll be delegating to.
By the time we make it out of the institute, it's already dark.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Hey, what are you gonna do?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: About?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: About Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It's true that the professor's proposal would be one way to keep the work going.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But it's not necessarily reducing the burden on Yonagi, is it? We would just be anesthetizing her so she doesn't feel it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, he is right that we all experience non-rem sleep every night.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But inducing it artificially isn't like natural sleep. It's possible we'll have to keep increasing the dosage, too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I know that, but...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We can't do this without master data from Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Besides, it's not as if we need to get her connecting hundreds of people at once. We only need to get to those seven.
Iruma narrows his eyes at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The professor was right that this isn't our research alone anymore. It now has more stakeholders than any project in the institute's history.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Well, yeah. I know, but...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Yonagi's just doing this to help with your research, isn't she?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...She's looking at the bigger picture, actually.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And...
We don't have any time to waste.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She wants to see the project succeed too. That's why I just need to tell her and see how she feels.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Mhm. Well, if you're the one doing it, I doubt she'll mince words.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: See you tomorrow.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, sorry for making you tag along.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh no, no! I have the time of my life when I’m with you, buddy!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Welcome back!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hello, girls.
I open the door, and I’m greeted by Yonagi and Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.
Our evening passes in its usual peaceful way.
Izumo makes me her porridge and Yonagi watches me eat it.
She's holding one of the novels she's writing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: More revisions today?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah. I’m sure I’ll keep writing. As long as I have feeling to put to paper, that is.
Her voice is soft.
I nod back at her.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: May I take the plate?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, thanks. It was delicious.
Izumo takes my empty dish and proceeds to wash it in the sink.
I find myself watching her from behind.
This peaceful life...
It cannot last forever.
We know very well that it's like fine sand, slowly escaping our grasp.
Yes, that’s why...
That's exactly why we swore to discuss everything, and argue about it if we need to. We don't want to waste a second on misunderstandings.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I spoke with the professor.
She nods silently.
Then she closes her notebook and moves it to a corner of the table.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we keep going with our the current method, we'll never complete the virtual space. That's why I went to ask for his advice today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right now we can barely maintain four simultaneous connections. We may be able to obtain the data we need for that number if you get acclimated to it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But you'll never make it to seven people.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That much is clear.
Yonagi nods along as I speak.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The solution that he suggested is...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: To put you in a deeper sleep when building the dreamscape.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Deeper?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You know there’s shallow and deep states of sleep, right? I think you can feel it when you sleep normally.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, kind of, I guess?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right now you’re creating a dreamscape while in a state of shallow sleep. That’s why you can remember the experiments that happen in it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I remember them as clearly as a normal dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's why the burden is getting heavier for you. In the end, your reactions to the participants' data input is what makes the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In a sense, you're consciously trying to sync up with the brain waves of all involved. You're trying empathize with everyone.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Empathize, huh? You may be right. When I'm in there, I can tell what people are thinking more than usual.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That could explain why the load is so heavy on you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So you’re saying that if you took the data while I was in a deeper sleep, it would work better?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder how my dreamscape would look then.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know. Maybe it would be manifestations of your memories, or maybe it would be an incomprehensible mess.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And everyone would go in there, and keep taking data like always, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That seems to be the only way at this point. Though we could come up with something else if we think about it more.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We don't have infinite time at our disposal.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Right.
Yonagi nods gravely, letting my words sink in.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It does sound scary, to be honest.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I mean, just having people in my head without my supervision.
Yonagi stares vacantly for a while at the wood grain in the table.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you want me to do?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's one thing on my mind.
Yonagi waits for me to go on, her eyes locked on me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we could move to the virtual space before you develop your memory disorder...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe you could live a full life in there.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This will be humanity's first time inhabiting a virtual space. A world where everyone is having vivid dreams all the time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can humans develop dementia while dreaming?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We don't know the answer to that yet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The thought of growing old together in the virtual space we've worked so hard for all these years...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That would be... the greatest happiness I could imagine.
Yonagi smiles and gives me a small nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes, you’re right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That’s why I don’t want to regret things later. I don’t want to just wait for the day you start forgetting. I want to try whatever I can.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So you want to try the method the professor came up with, right?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay. Let’s try it out.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even if I'm unconscious, you'll be there, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then I’m okay with it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Thank you. I'm sorry for making you shoulder the burden alone every time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're not. I know you struggle with the weight of this more than anyone.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's that passion of yours that's led everyone in the lab to follow you as well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: let’s try it. I believe you can make it happen.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I’ll make it happen.
The next day, about half of the lab personnel we sent out return.
They make it sound like there's wide variance in the abilities of the labs we'll be using.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Starting today, we'll be changing the mechanism we use to build Yonagi's dreamscape. The burden on her body has increased since we started connecting with four people.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This could be improved by switching Yonagi from a half-awake state to an unconscious one. We're gonna try that today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi herself might not manifest in the dreamscape under these conditions. We'll send in four people simultaneously today.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The whole project is riding on whether we can obtain master data from the original dreamscape with seven people at the same time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The longer we spend on this stage, the greater the burden on her will be, so I ask you to keep that in mind as you work.
Iruma nods, followed by the rest of the researchers.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Let us begin.
Just like the professor said, we have several types of drugs capable of producing non-rem sleep for any period of time.
I choose the one with the most data from clinical trials.
It's a trustworthy drug with no instances of adverse effects in any of these trials.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay. Kaito, Izumo, I'm in your hands now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I’m right here.
Yonagi smiles at Izumo and me before drinking the pill with some water.
It doesn’t take long for her to fall asleep.
She’s sleeping soundly.
On the outside, she looks the same as she usually does.
But the monitor is indeed displaying mainly δ waves.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, let’s get in. Izumo, begin the connection process.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Now beginning intercommunication between the participants and Yonagi.
The rest of us take the REM sleep-inducing pills and enter her dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It’s pure white.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, are you monitoring this?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I am.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It’s all white, and there’s nothing here. How much of the dreamscape is formed? I can’t make anything out.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The extent of the dreamscape is immeasurable.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There are no boundaries. The space is virtually endless.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wha—

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: But we can still walk in here, right?
Iruma takes a cautious fist step, then starts walking around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you map something onto this, Izumo?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I can. What would you like me to project?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The 2016 educational institu—

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Whoa, that was fast.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I have not projected it yet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The dreamscape Yonagi's projecting just changed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What does that mean?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Unknown. No input has been sent from our end.
The space updated itself to reflect the order I gave to Izumo?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Also, I am receiving duplicate voice data from the participants.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The data I receive directly from Yonagi contains the voice data of the participants.
Our current layout involves the relay taking in the data from Yonagi's dreamscape, then writing in the action signals from the participants and transmitting the whole to all involved.
If those action signals are going out duplicated, it means...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Does this mean we could speak in her dreamscape without going through the relay?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It is possible.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, cancel the relay's intervention in the dreamscape and connect the participants to Yonagi directly.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Relay processing has been canceled.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Did something happen?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We’re speaking, yes?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Huh? Sure, your lips move, and words come out.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let’s try moving around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...It’s just normal.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: It sure feels like it.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: So what now? Do we go through the action list?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm...
If the burden on Yonagi becomes too high, Izumo will stop it.
I nod in response to the gathered researchers.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah,we need to take this chance to get the data we need on four simultaneous connections.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: All right.
We follow the list as Izumo dictates it. We'll easily be able to get all the data we need.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, let’s move on to the next list. Now we...
It takes me a moment to realize that I lost my voice.
Not just me, but all the participants are exchanging surprised looks, their mouths hanging open.
I try to scream, but nothing comes out.
Did something happen?
Is Yonagi okay?
Yonagi...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ngh...
As I come to, I realize I'm out of the dreamscape.
We're in the lab's simulation room.
As I jump out of the capsule chair, I'm met with Izumo's steady gaze.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Did something happen, Izumo? Did the burden on Yonagi increase?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: No. She entered REM sleep.
I check out her brain wave display.
The δ waves seen during deep sleep have become a mixture of θ and β waves.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see. So she’s waking up.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Why did we lose our voices in there?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi’s dreamscape is first and foremost a world where Yonagi can project the things she envision into people’s brains.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In order for us to participate at all in that space, we need to upload information about ourselves to the dreamscape, but obviously we're not telepaths.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Probably.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's why I made Wooleep. He could take in the images Yonagi projected as well as the participants' intended actions, then integrate them all and relay them to everyone involved.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You usually can's speak if you enter her dreamscape directly. Like we did just now.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I see, so we've been making progress with workarounds.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wonder, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why could we speak today?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Want to go and see what the professor thinks about it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I suppose.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh... Ngh...
I hear a sleepy groan and rush over to Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you okay, Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kai...to?
She still seems a little groggy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, what’s her condition?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Blood pressure and blood sugar slightly low. Standard when waking up.
I heave a sigh of relief once more.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? We’re in the lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. The experiment is over.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, right, yeah. We were trying a new method, right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. I think it went well. You were really brave, thank you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?
I give her a resolute nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I’m glad to hear that.
Like yesterday, the three of us gather around the director's table and report today's results.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The four-person connection went well, and Yonagi didn't exhaust herself, so that problem has been solved. However...
The professor and Iruma watch me carefully.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The fact we could act in her dreamscape by connecting directly was extremely unusual. I've never seen that happen before.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Though we got the results we wanted, I want to get to the bottom of what’s happening now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I believe the answer is relatively obvious.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In simplified terms, you entered her dream during a non-REM sleep, correct?
Me and Iruma nod.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Perhaps in such a state, Yonagi's brain becomes unable to determine which sensory inputs belong to her, and which come in from the outside.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see... So she was mistaking the sensory input of the participants for her own and integrating them into the dreamscape.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I believe we can intuitively understand how the brain is prone to make such mistakes.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Why is that?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Let's say, for example, that I appear in one of your dreams and start hurling insults. Who did those insults come from, and who are they aimed at?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Would you think it's something that the real me said to you?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: No, it would be something I came up with myself. It’s my dream, after all.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's right. Fundamentally speaking, the dreamer is responsible for their dreams.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The brain knows that.
