texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: During the period when Yonagi had no sense of self, her brain may have been mistaking all sensory input as coming from her.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That was then reflected back at you through Yonagi's innate ability to create images in the dreamscape.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Kaito, do you understand what that means?
I slowly nod in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It means...
The thing the professor and Yonagi’s father could never achieve. A space that can emulate all senses, and where all participants can act as they wish.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The virtual space we’ve been chasing... It’s complete.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That’s right.
If her sense of self is what's responsible for separating her own sensory input from external input...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Does that mean that Yonagi could become the virtual space itself?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If we dispossess her of her sense of self, yes.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Professor! That’s impossible!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Yes, there are countless problems with that approach, ethical and otherwise. But even more importantly...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It sounds like when you imagined the shape you wanted to give to the dreamscape, it happened immediately, correct?
I nod.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Why did you have the authority to shape it?
Why, indeed.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: For argument's sake, let's suppose we take the inhumane approach of turning Yonagi herself into the virtual space.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The biggest risk is that there'd be someone's will shaping the world humanity migrates to.
The will of the world itself. In this case, naturally, Yonagi's will.
A completely unaware subconscious mind. It might assign value to the sensory inputs it's receiving.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You mean it was her will to give me authority in that space?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's the only conclusion available.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The space we create cannot be one where the participants' wills are assigned unequal levels of importance.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It would be, in effect, a dictatorship.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So we shouldn't even entertain the idea of the inhumane approach.
After saying his part, the professor smiles, picks up his mug and raises it to his lips.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Is Yonagi feeling okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes, for now at least. She seemed a little dazed after waking up, but she was okay right after.
The professor nods.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I assume we can conclude that the obstacle to obtaining data from seven simultaneous connections is gone.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I think so.
I reach for my own mug and have good sip of the still warm coffee.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We began testing the prototypes on our end. We'll start by putting a researcher into deep sleep for a week.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If this goes well, we'll just focus on improving energy efficiency as much as we can before going into mass production.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That’s great news!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Manufacturing hardware takes a long time. It has to be transported to the actual site and go through operational testing.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Now that you mention it, where are we planning to store that many capsules?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Behind the solar panels between the top and middle side.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That space was originally reserved for topsiders who want to wait for surface migration in cold sleep.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's the perfect location.
My eyes widen in surprise. This is the first I'm hearing of this.
A set of solar panels encircling a vertical shaft with a diameter of 1600 meters. I'd assumed they were just there to supplement our electricity supply.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do all topsiders do that?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'd say about half of our elderly population is there. The other half live out their lives in the city.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Half, wow... They miss the sun that much?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose I can see where they’re coming from.
I look out the window.
From the window of the director's office on the top floor of the research building, we can see one end of a huge solar panel.
Even at night, the panels shimmer ever so slightly in the lights of the city.
To think that place would be full of people sleeping, waiting patiently to resume life on the surface... it seems this city still has many secrets.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Next month, we'll do a test run of a mass production line.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I want to move to testing of the first stage prototype within a month. We need to get those small-scale tests started or we'll never make it.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Three years go by in a flash, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, time just flies by.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Welcome back, honey!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, Yonagi.
I’m met with Yonagi’s smile as I open the door.
Feeling my tension loosen a little, I smile back at her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How are you feeling?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I’m fit as a fiddle! It felt like I took a huge power nap.
I nod, feeling a little relieved.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, did you run the rest?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes. I will display the results now.
The test results appear on the terminal on the table.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A little above average, huh? Standard, then.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I did great today!
She looks at me, her eyes shining.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm glad. I was really worried.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo told me a bit about it. The experiment in the dreamscape went well, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. If we keep going at this pace, the Kaito Lab's main job will be over in no time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Cool!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And it's all thanks to you. Thank you for being so brave. Everyone appreciates it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Have you had dinner yet?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nah.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will prepare it.
When we're resting after dinner, I notice Yonagi staring at me from across the table.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes?
She just keeps on smiling at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
After a silent moment, she gently rests her hand on top of mine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey... Do you think we could go and visit the other house tonight?
She gives me a bashful look.
I respond with a small nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sure, let’s go.
As soon as we arrive at the house, she throws herself at me before we can even shower off.
I manage to hold back her incensed passion for long enough to get us both to our room, and we fall together onto the bed.
Yonagi keeps calling my name when we're together.
I respond in kind and call her name again and again.
She's in control the whole time.
As soon as we finish, she collapses on top of me and trusts herself to my arms.
The lights of the middle square seep through the window.
A beautiful moon is projected in one of the monitors.
If we were on the surface, the moonlight could illuminate our room completely.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes?
She remains silent for a moment.
Eventually, her voice trickles out in an almost imperceptible murmur.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Can you forget what I’m about to say? If I ask you to forget, would you do it?
I turn my gaze to her.
With her face buried into my chest, I can’t see her expression.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just need to say this... I want to get it off my chest or I'm gonna explode.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes. Tell me.
She breathes slowly, still hiding her face.
I simply feel her warm breath brush against my skin.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Can we stop the experiments?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to stop going to the lab. I just want you, Izumo, and Wooleep...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Couldn’t we just... live our lives in peace?
I’m stunned speechless.
I can feel her trembling on top of me.
Her tears wet my skin.
I've seen her cry like this before.
She cried like this when we slept together for the first time, in the small bed in our low side house.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can’t we just weed out the parks, or repair broken pipes like the old days?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then we could get our rations, and I could hold them in our pot as we walked through the fields together on our way home.
Her voice begins to quiver.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then Izumo would grab whatever food we got and turn it into porridge, and we could giggle as we watch her cook...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Can’t we go back to those days?
The silence stretches on. I keep stroking her hair as she shivers in my arms.
It's only when I'm about to say something that she speaks up.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I’m sorry.
She says the words hoarsely and clings to me.
She holds me so tightly.
She holds her breath for what feels like hours.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I’m sorry!
She sounds like herself again as she looks up at me.
Her eyes are red from crying even as she smiles.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just had to get that off my chest. I just wanted you to hear me say it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Actually, I'd say it was more like I finally realized something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Were you scared today?
She nods, her smile not diminished one bit.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Just a little bit.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Actually, I’d say it was more like I understood something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What was it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know, with Dad, there were days when he forgot everything, and days when he acted like his usual self... and he flipped back and forth for a while.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was so ready to go through the same thing, preparing myself for more and more times when I wasn't myself...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But after all day without remembering or knowing what was happening... I realized that's how it must feel.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I realized that's how it feels to be unaware and having to try and keep going along with everyone else just to look normal.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just realized...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That’s what’s waiting for me in the future.
I hold her even tighter than before.
I don't want a millimeter of daylight between us.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But it’s already decided, isn’t it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That we'll do everything we can to help the people of the city.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's what we decided, after all.
Yonagi nods to herself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So just forget what I said.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I’m sorry for being weird.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, we can stop.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We won’t stop.
Her tone is as firm as steel as she remains in my arms.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But... thanks.
